greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Inverse binomial transform of the number of planar partitions (A000219).
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..3000
formula: G.f.: (1/(1 + x))*exp(Sum_{k>=1} sigma_2(k)*x^k/(k*(1 + x)^k)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 20 2018
mathematica: nmax = 40; s = CoefficientList[Series[Product[1/(1-x^k)^k, {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x]; Table[Sum[(-1)^(n-k) * Binomial[n, k] * s[[k+1]], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, nmax}]
results.author: _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Nov 01 2017
